snippet: Without full worldwide support, the International Criminal Court often cannot bring perpetrators of crimes against humanity to justice.
abstract: News Analysis; South Africa's refusal to arrest Sudanese Pres Omar Hassan al-Bashir on International Criminal Court warrant points out limitations of justice system that has no enforcement capability; move also illustrates ways in which member states use court to advance political interests.
lead_paragraph: Without full worldwide support, the International Criminal Court often cannot bring perpetrators of crimes against humanity to justice.

headline.print_headline: Lacking Support, International Court Becomes Not-So-Long Arm of the Law
headline.main: Omar al-Bashir Case Shows International Criminal Court’s Limitations

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
